parse.title: Central South University of Forestry and Technology

text.*:
Central South University of Forestry and Technology
中南林业科技大学
Motto 树木树人、求是求新
Type Public university
Established 1958 (1958)
President Liao Xiaoping (廖小平)
Academic staff
 2,510
Students 41,000
Location Changsha, Hunan, China
Campus 2,230 mu
Website english.csuft.edu.cn
The teaching building.
The teaching building.
Students' dormitory.
The CSUFT Bridge.
The Library.

Central South University of Forestry and Technology (CSUFT; simplified Chinese: 中南林业科技大学; traditional Chinese: 中南林業科技大學; pinyin: Zhōngnán Línyè Kējì Dàxué) is a university located in Changsha, Hunan, China.[1][2][3][4] The university covers a total area of 2,230 mu, with more than 101.3 square meters of floor space.[4][5]

As of fall 2013, the university has 3 campuses, a combined student body of 41,000 students, 2,510 faculty members.[4][5]

The university consists of 22 colleges, with 69 specialties for undergraduates, 97 specialties for master's degree candidates and 44 specialties for Doctoral candidates. At present, the university has 7 research institutions and research centres, including 4 national engineering research centres, 3 key national discipline, 1 national key laboratory.[4][5]

Contents

  • 1 History
  • 2 Academics
  • 3 Library collections
  • 4 Culture
  • 5 People
    • 5.1 Notable alumni

History[edit]

Central South University of Forestry and Technology was founded in 1958, it was initially called "Hunan Academy of Forestry".[4]

In November 2001, Hunan School of Forestry and Hunan Forestry Industrial School merged into Hunan Academy of Forestry.

In December 2005, it was renamed "Central South University of Forestry and Technology".

Library collections[edit]

Central South University of Forestry and Technology's total collection amounts to more than 2.7734 million items.

  • Motto: 树木树人、求是求新
